pr_title: [homematic] For non HmIP dimmers stateDescription values must be corrected too

timeline.message:
For non HmIP dimmers stateDescription values must be corrected too

Older HM dimmers are using a maximum values of 1.0. But also for these
devices the values must be corrected.


Signed-off-by: Martin Herbst <develop@mherbst.de>

timeline.bodyText: float and double shouldn't be compared with ==. You could use >= and <=.
timeline.author: fwolter

replies.bodyText: I agree with you, that == is normally not a good idea for float/double. In this case I tested it with these values, but I changed the comparison to make it more safe.
replies.author: MHerbst

replies.bodyText: Wouldn't it be better to create a new BigDecimal(dp.getMaxValue().toString()) and use compareTo(new BigDecimal("1.01"))? Then the compared values would still make sense for the reader of the code.
replies.author: XeS0r

replies.bodyText: I thought about using BigDecimal for the comparison but I wanted to avoid the overhead.
replies.author: MHerbst

replies.bodyText:
I've checked the code and maxValue from HmDataPoint() is already converted to BigDecimal() at that point. Therefore we could simply use the max variable for comparism.
max.compareTo(BigDecimal.valueof("1.0") == 0 || max.compareTo(BigDecimal.valueof("1.01") == 0
Maybe that is a better solution. What do you think?
replies.author: XeS0r

replies.bodyText: Hmm, I think this would be similar to my original solution with "==".
replies.author: MHerbst

replies.bodyText: max is BigDecimal() and therefore compareTo() would honor it's value properly instead of "==".
replies.author: XeS0r

replies.bodyText: How should we proceed? I would really like to see this fix in OH3 before it will be released.
replies.author: XeS0r

replies.bodyText: I agree to @XeS0r this is even more elegeant. The final version of OH3 is probably already built. In any case there's a complete freeze. So, this will probably go into 3.1.
replies.author: fwolter

replies.bodyText: OK, you conviced me. I have changed it to compareTo (valueOf is not available for String, instead a constructor must be used)
replies.author: MHerbst

replies.bodyText: @fwolter I have changed the coding according to your proposal. Maybe you can find some time to review it again (and hopefully merge it).
replies.author: MHerbst
